lexUnit.name: tricky.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: requiring care and skill because difficult or awkward

sentence.text: Correcting backlight while carrying out a tilt is rather tricky .
Fixing a curtain rail to the top of a window surround can be a rather tricky business .
After a rather tricky , sea-washed beginning , the true nature of the rock becomes apparent .
It can be rather tricky to install correctly , but once up and running , it 's a straightforward' serious image editor .
And he 's always been pretty decent -- bailing me out of rather tricky situations I got into , and not coming down too heavily about them . "
None of this was his business , despite the fact that he had helped her out of a rather … tricky situation .
The need for guidance is not , of course , restricted to the female sex , and it could be very tricky trying to distinguish the essential differences between male and female archetypes of the guide .
They were very tricky to manipulate and inconsistent , however , several photographers achieved extremely high standards with the process .
This can be a very tricky area as most people are self.conscious in front of the camera .
The Braun Independent heated up very quickly , but Sarah found it tricky to use the tong without the ends of her hair having a kink .
Changing a light bulb can be very tricky , especially if a two-way switch makes it difficult to tell whether the light is switched on or off .
Finding out the exact proportions and method of preparation will take some time and be a very tricky operation .
He must be very tricky to deal with , she thought darkly .
Naturally , the tricky business of welding the Germanies together could still bring nasty surprises .
But running doubles is a tricky business .
Achieving total independence without loneliness or self absorption is a tricky business for everyone .
Using chemicals can be a tricky business , especially when it comes to working out how much to use .
The tricky question would be the unit pricing structure .
Finally , the allocation of the overheads raises some tricky questions .
All the really tricky questions are declared meaningless , despite the fact that they are sufficiently well comprehended to give rise to perplexity .
Transfer between hierarchies is a complex procedure , often raising tricky questions concerning the loss or preservation of seniority rights .
I felt better now and decided to lie my way out of a tricky situation .
The clearer you are about your behavioural rights the better prepared you are to handle tricky situations assertively .
The only hope in a tricky situation is to look to your behaviour and use it to influence the behaviour of others for the better .
They were too alike , they annoyed and inflamed each other now and then , which made for a tricky situation .
A captain goes last on to his ship , but a man goes first into a tricky situation .
What was always going to be an extremely tricky situation has now been made even more unfavourable for the Government -- by the Government .
Yet the skill it has shown in the last three weeks suggests it is well equipped for the tricky tasks ahead .
Warsaw wrestles with tricky task of selling share ownership to the workers .
Mr Annuar is from Kelantan , which helps explain why , at the tender age of 34 , he has the tricky task of preventing PAS from achieving its goals .
There 's also an option to practise serving : a tricky task involving quickly guiding a small cross into the service box .
For all their logic , big-bank mergers have proved tricky to arrange .
Passenger services will be trickier to privatise , both because they are less profitable and because , unlike wagons , passengers have votes .
The rights that you do possess may be tricky to enforce .
It 's a bit tricky to get to St Katharine 's by the Tower at 22 miles , but the views are well worth the effort .
Dado and picture rails can be tricky to remove without seriously damaging the plaster -- it all depends on whether they were fixed in place before the walls were plastered or afterwards .
Firstly the leg shape is tricky to achieve , and to have shaped a pair of legs in mahogany before I touched the ebony was good practice .
If she had been unfaithful it would have been tricky to intervene .
The May Hill Stakes , frequently an early guide to the following year 's Classics , is much more tricky to predict .
Phases of the moon are tricky to explain .
It would be a bit tricky for the count to keep her shut away if they were staying with him .
After snapping up four birdies , he said : ` The course was hideously tricky in that wind .
As Mellowes said , negotiations had reached a tricky stage .
Duggan has taken a ski-ing holiday in the United States while the tricky negotiations were taking place this weekend .
A fine position , constant exposure , and some tricky sections ensure it status as one of the greatest sea cliff classics .
Contrary to expectations , there appears to be a broad convergence of views between the two men , even on such tricky issues as Bosnia , NATO , the EC and the GATT trade talks .
The liberal-historians , on the other hand , tend to find themselves in a somewhat more tricky position .
A tricky wind was blowing on to the anchorage and what with snakes and the prospect of getting wet I lay off for lunch .
Drivers faced a tricky journey to work .
But making the transition from user to supplier can be tricky .
Some of the incidents can be tricky .
Getting the tank into the dining room was a little bit tricky .
Applying the principle to property descriptions is tricky .
` This might be a lot more tricky than I had first supposed .
